Description: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) is a proprietary information security standard. It's administered by the PCI Security Standards Council, which was founded by American Express, Discover Financial Services, JCB International, MasterCard Worldwide, and Visa Inc. PCI DSS applies to entities that store, process, or transmit cardholder data (CHD) or sensitive authentication data (SAD). This includes, but isn't limited to, merchants, processors, acquirers, issuers, and service providers. The PCI DSS is mandated by the card brands and administered by the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council.

Requirements.Description: Checks if HTTP to HTTPS redirection is configured on all HTTP listeners of Azure Application Gateway. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if one or more HTTP listeners of Azure Application Gateway do not have HTTP to HTTPS redirection configured. The rule is also NON_COMPLIANT if one or more HTTP listeners are forwarding traffic to another HTTP listener instead of enforcing redirection.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Front Door or Azure CDN endpoints are using deprecated SSL protocols for HTTPS communication between edge locations and custom origins. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT for an Azure Front Door or CDN profile if any TLS settings include outdated protocols such as TLS 1.0 or TLS 1.1.
Requirements.Name: Azure CDN

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Front Door and Azure CDN profiles are using a minimum security policy and cipher suite of TLSv1.2 or greater for viewer connections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the minimum TLS version configured is below TLS 1.2.
Requirements.Name: Azure CDN

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Front Door and Azure CDN profiles are using a custom SSL certificate and are configured to use SNI (Server Name Indication) to serve HTTPS requests. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a custom SSL certificate is associated but the SSL support method is using a dedicated IP address instead of SNI.
Requirements.Name: Azure CDN

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Front Door and Azure CDN profiles are encrypting traffic to custom origins. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if OriginProtocolPolicy is set to HTTP only or if OriginProtocolPolicy is set to Match viewer and ViewerProtocolPolicy allows both HTTP and HTTPS traffic.
Requirements.Name: Azure CDN

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Front Door and Azure CDN profiles enforce HTTPS (directly or via a redirection). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the ViewerProtocolPolicy allows both HTTP and HTTPS traffic for the Default Route Configuration or Custom Route Configurations.
Requirements.Name: Azure CDN

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure AI Search nodes are encrypted end to end. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if node-to-node encryption is not enabled for the Azure OpenSearch domain.
Requirements.Name: Azure AI Search

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether your Azure Load Balancer or Application Gateway SSL listeners are using a custom SSL policy. The rule is applicable only if SSL listeners are configured for the Azure Application Gateway or Azure Front Door. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the SSL policy does not follow the organizations security standards.
Requirements.Name: Azure Load Balancer

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Application Gateway or Azure Front Door SSL listeners use a predefined SSL policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the SSL policy configured for the HTTPS/SSL listener does not match the value of the parameter predefinedPolicyName.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Application Gateway or Azure Front Door is configured with SSL or HTTPS listeners. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a listener is not configured to use HTTPS with a valid SSL certificate.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure HDInsight clusters have Enterprise Security Package (ESP) with Kerberos authentication enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a security configuration is not attached to the cluster or if the security configuration does not meet the specified rule parameters.
Requirements.Name: Azure HDInsight

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether connections to Azure AI Search services are using HTTPS. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the EnforceHTTPS setting is not enabled or if the minimum TLS version does not meet the required security policy.
Requirements.Name: Azure AI Search

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure AI Search services have end-to-end encryption enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if node-to-node encryption is not enabled for the search service.
Requirements.Name: Azure AI Search

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) requires TLS/SSL encryption for connections to SQL clients. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any Azure Synapse Analytics workspace does not enforce SSL connections.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage accounts enforce secure transfer (HTTPS/TLS) for all requests. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any Azure Storage account allows requests over HTTP instead of requiring HTTPS/TLS.
Requirements.Name: Azure Blob Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Storage Account with SFTP enabled allows unencrypted FTP connections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the storage account permits FTP instead of requiring SFTP or FTPS for secure endpoint connections.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) allowing unrestricted inbound traffic (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0) only permit TCP or UDP connections on authorized ports. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if NSG rules allow inbound traffic on ports not specified in the rule parameters.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.5: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) APIs are configured with the specified endpoint type as defined in the rule parameter. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API does not match the expected endpoint configuration type.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure API Management (APIM) API stage is configured with an SSL certificate. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API stage does not have an associated SSL certificate for secure communication.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) APIs are associated with Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) policies. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an APIM API is not associated with a WAF policy to protect against web threats and vulnerabilities.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Front Door profiles are associated with an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Front Door profile is not linked to a WAF policy, which helps protect against web threats and vulnerabilities.
Requirements.Name: Azure Front Door

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the certificate associated with an Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) endpoint is the default SSL certificate. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure CDN endpoint is using the default SSL certificate instead of a custom-managed certificate.
Requirements.Name: Azure Content Delivery Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure DevOps repository URL contains embedded credentials. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the repository URL includes any username or password in the connection string and COMPLIANT if it does not.
Requirements.Name: Azure DevOps

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) instances are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the public access setting is enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database Migration Service

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cosmos DB manual backups are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any manual backup snapshots are publicly available.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure VPN Client Authorization Rules allow connection access for all clients. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if AccessAll is present and set to true in the Azure Virtual WAN User VPN configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure VPN

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the compliance status of Azure Automation State Configuration (DSC) is COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT after applying the configuration on the virtual machine. The rule is COMPLIANT if the compliance status field is set to COMPLIANT in Azure Policy guest configuration or Azure Automation State Configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Automation State Configuration

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual WAN Hubs have Auto-Accept Shared Connections enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Virtual Hubs setting for automatically accepting shared connections is set to Enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual WAN

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) API server endpoint is not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API server endpoint is exposed to the public internet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Kubernetes Service

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search service is deployed within an Azure Virtual Network (VNet). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the service endpoint is publicly accessible instead of being restricted to a private VNet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cognitive Search

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Application Gateway and Azure Load Balancer listeners are configured to use SSL/TLS certificates from Azure Key Vault. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if at least one load balancer has at least one listener that is not configured with a certificate from Azure Key Vault or is using a certificate from an untrusted source.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Application Gateway uses SSL certificates provided by Azure Key Vault. To use this rule, an SSL or HTTPS listener must be configured with Azure Application Gateway. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Application Gateway is using a self-signed or untrusted SSL certificate instead of a certificate from Azure Key Vault. This rule does not apply to Azure Load Balancer.
Requirements.Name: Azure Aplication Gateway

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure HDInsight cluster has public network access disabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if public network access is enabled or if the NSG (Network Security Group) rules allow inbound traffic on ports other than the required management port (e.g., SSH on Port 22).
Requirements.Name: Azure HDInsight

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) restrict inbound SSH (Port 22) access from the public internet. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there is an NSG rule allowing unrestricted inbound SSH connections (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0).
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Network (VNet) gateways are attached only to authorized virtual networks. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure VPN Gateway or Azure Virtual Network Gateway is attached to an unauthorized VNet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure Function App policy attached to the function resource prohibits public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure Function App policy allows public access. Additionally, it ensures that Azure Private Endpoints or Access Restrictions are properly configured to limit exposure.
Requirements.Name: Azure Functions

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Function App is configured to use a Virtual Network (VNet) Integration. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Function App is not connected to a VNet, which may expose it to public access instead of securing it within a private network.
Requirements.Name: Azure Functions

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) allow unrestricted inbound traffic on default ports for SSH (22) or RDP (3389). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an NSG inbound rule allows traffic from any source (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0) on ports 22 (SSH) or 3389 (RDP), which could expose resources to unauthorized access.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy is configured with a user-defined stateless default action for fragmented packets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the stateless default action for fragmented packets does not match the user-defined default action, which could lead to inconsistent or insecure traffic handling.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy is associated with stateful or stateless rule collections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no stateful or stateless rule collections are associated with the Azure Firewall Policy, ensuring that traffic filtering rules are properly enforced.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy Rule Collection Group contains rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules in a Rule Collection Group, ensuring that traffic filtering is properly enforced.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are public routes in the Azure Route Table pointing to an Internet gateway (IGW) equivalent, such as Azure Virtual Network NAT or a user-defined route (UDR) directing traffic to the internet. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a route has a destination CIDR block of 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0, or if the destination CIDR block does not align with the rule parameters, ensuring that traffic is not unintentionally exposed to the internet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search instances are deployed within an Azure Virtual Network (VNet). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cognitive Search service endpoint is publicly accessible instead of being restricted to a private network using Private Endpoints or Service Endpoints.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cognitive Search

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are any Azure Database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server firewall rules that are not the default firewall rule. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are any custom firewall rules that allow unrestricted access instead of using the default security configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server instances are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publicNetworkAccess field is set to Enabled in the instance configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) dedicated SQL pools are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publicNetworkAccess field is set to Enabled in the workspace or dedicated SQL pool configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage access points have public access blocked. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if public access settings are not disabled for Azure Storage accounts.

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access block settings are configured at the Azure Storage account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the specified settings do not match the corresponding configuration fields in the Azure Storage account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access block settings are configured at the Azure Storage account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the configuration settings do not match one or more specified parameters (or default values).
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage containers are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a storage container is not listed in the excludedPublicContainers parameter and its access level is set to public.

Attributes.Section: 1.2.8: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Blob Storage containers do not allow public read access. The rule checks the Public Access Level settings, the container access policies, and the container-level role assignments.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Blob Storage containers do not allow public write access. The rule checks the Public Access Level settings, the container access policies, and the container-level role assignments.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Machine Learning workspace notebook instance is deployed within a Virtual Network (VNet) or within a list of approved subnets. Requirements.Description: Checks if direct internet access is disabled for an Azure Machine Learning workspace notebook instance. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Machine Learning notebook instance is internet-enabled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure Function App policy attached to the function resource prohibits public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure Function App policy allows public access. Additionally, it ensures that Azure Private Endpoints or Access Restrictions are properly configured to limit exposure.
Requirements.Name: Azure Functions

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Function App is configured to use a Virtual Network (VNet) Integration. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Function App is not connected to a VNet, which may expose it to public access instead of securing it within a private network.
Requirements.Name: Azure Functions

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) allow unrestricted inbound traffic on default ports for SSH (22) or RDP (3389). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an NSG inbound rule allows traffic from any source (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0) on ports 22 (SSH) or 3389 (RDP), which could expose resources to unauthorized access.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy is configured with a user-defined stateless default action for fragmented packets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the stateless default action for fragmented packets does not match the user-defined default action, which could lead to inconsistent or insecure traffic handling.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy is associated with stateful or stateless rule collections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no stateful or stateless rule collections are associated with the Azure Firewall Policy, ensuring that traffic filtering rules are properly enforced.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy Rule Collection Group contains rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules in a Rule Collection Group, ensuring that traffic filtering is properly enforced.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are public routes in the Azure Route Table pointing to an Internet gateway (IGW) equivalent, such as Azure Virtual Network NAT or a user-defined route (UDR) directing traffic to the internet. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a route has a destination CIDR block of 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0, or if the destination CIDR block does not align with the rule parameters, ensuring that traffic is not unintentionally exposed to the internet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search instances are deployed within an Azure Virtual Network (VNet). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cognitive Search service endpoint is publicly accessible instead of being restricted to a private network using Private Endpoints or Service Endpoints.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cognitive Search

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are any Azure Database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server firewall rules that are not the default firewall rule. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are any custom firewall rules that allow unrestricted access instead of using the default security configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server instances are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publicNetworkAccess field is set to Enabled in the instance configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) dedicated SQL pools are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publicNetworkAccess field is set to Enabled in the workspace or dedicated SQL pool configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics dedicated SQL pool has Private Link enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Private Link is not enabled or if the configuration field is set to false.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage access points have public access blocked. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if public access settings are not disabled for Azure Storage accounts.
Requirements.Name: Azure Blob Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access block settings are configured at the Azure Storage account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the specified settings do not match the corresponding configuration fields in the Azure Storage account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access block settings are configured at the Azure Storage account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the configuration settings do not match one or more specified parameters (or default values).
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage containers are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a storage container is not listed in the excludedPublicContainers parameter and its access level is set to public.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Blob Storage containers do not allow public read access. The rule checks the Public Access Level settings, the container access policies, and the container-level role assignments.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Blob Storage containers do not allow public write access. The rule checks the Public Access Level settings, the container access policies, and the container-level role assignments.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Machine Learning workspace notebook instance is deployed within a Virtual Network (VNet) or within a list of approved subnets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a notebook instance is not deployed within a VNet or if its subnet ID is not included in the parameter list.
Requirements.Name: Azure Machine Learning

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if direct internet access is disabled for an Azure Machine Learning workspace notebook instance. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Machine Learning notebook instance is internet-enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Machine Learning

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Private Endpoint for the service provided in the rule parameter is created for each Azure Virtual Network (VNet). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure VNet does not have a Private Endpoint created for the service.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are unused Network Security Groups (NSGs). The rule is COMPLIANT if each NSG is associated with a subnet or network interface. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an NSG is not associated with any subnet or network interface.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if DNS resolution from peered virtual networks (VNets) to private IP is enabled in Azure Virtual Network Peering. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if DNS resolution from the peered VNet to private IP is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) allowing unrestricted inbound traffic (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0) only permit TCP or UDP connections on authorized ports. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if NSG rules allow inbound traffic on ports not specified in the rule parameters.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if both VPN tunnels provided by Azure Site-to-Site VPN are in Connected status. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if one or both tunnels are in Disconnected status.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) policy contains any rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules defined within the WAF policy rule set.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) global rule contains any conditions. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no conditions are defined within the WAF global rule set.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) Global Web ACL contains any WAF rules or rule groups. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Web ACL does not include any WAF rule or rule group.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) Regional rule group contains any rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules present within a WAF Regional rule group.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) regional rule contains any conditions. This rule is COMPLIANT if the regional rule contains at least one condition and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) regional Web ACL contains any WAF rules or rule groups. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no WAF rules or rule groups present within the Web ACL.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.1: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure API Management API stage is using an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) web access control list (Web ACL). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure WAF Web ACL is not used or if the applied WAF Web ACL does not match the expected configuration in the rule parameter.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) APIs are configured with the specified endpoint type as defined in the rule parameter. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API does not match the expected endpoint configuration type.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure API Management (APIM) API stage is configured with an SSL certificate. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API stage does not have an associated SSL certificate for secure communication.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) APIs are associated with Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) policies. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an APIM API is not associated with a WAF policy to protect against web threats and vulnerabilities.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Front Door profiles are associated with an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Front Door profile is not linked to a WAF policy, which helps protect against web threats and vulnerabilities.
Requirements.Name: Azure Front Door

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the certificate associated with an Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) endpoint is the default SSL certificate. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure CDN endpoint is using the default SSL certificate instead of a custom-managed certificate.
Requirements.Name: Azure Content Delivery Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure DevOps repository URL contains embedded credentials. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the repository URL includes any username or password in the connection string and COMPLIANT if it does not.
Requirements.Name: Azure DevOps

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) instances are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the public access setting is enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database Migration Service

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cosmos DB manual backups are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any manual backup snapshots are publicly available.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure VPN Client Authorization Rules allow connection access for all clients. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if AccessAll is present and set to true in the Azure Virtual WAN User VPN configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure VPN

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the compliance status of Azure Automation State Configuration (DSC) is COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT after applying the configuration on the virtual machine. The rule is COMPLIANT if the compliance status field is set to COMPLIANT in Azure Policy guest configuration or Azure Automation State Configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Automation State Configuration

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual WAN Hubs have Auto-Accept Shared Connections enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Virtual Hubs setting for automatically accepting shared connections is set to Enabled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) API server endpoint is not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API server endpoint is exposed to the public internet.

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cache for Redis instances are configured with a custom virtual network (VNet) integration. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cache for Redis instance is using the default network configuration instead of a custom VNet and subnet.

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search service is deployed within an Azure Virtual Network (VNet). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the service endpoint is publicly accessible instead of being restricted to a private VNet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cognitive Search

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Application Gateway and Azure Load Balancer listeners are configured to use SSL/TLS certificates from Azure Key Vault. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if at least one load balancer has at least one listener that is not configured with a certificate from Azure Key Vault or is using a certificate from an untrusted source.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Application Gateway uses SSL certificates provided by Azure Key Vault. To use this rule, an SSL or HTTPS listener must be configured with Azure Application Gateway. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Application Gateway is using a self-signed or untrusted SSL certificate instead of a certificate from Azure Key Vault. This rule does not apply to Azure Load Balancer.
Requirements.Name: Azure Aplication Gateway

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure HDInsight cluster has public network access disabled. Requirements.Name: Azure HDInsight

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) restrict inbound SSH (Port 22) access from the public internet. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there is an NSG rule allowing unrestricted inbound SSH connections (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0).
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.3.2: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Network (VNet) gateways are attached only to authorized virtual networks. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure VPN Gateway or Azure Virtual Network Gateway is attached to an unauthorized VNet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.1: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are public routes in the Azure Route Table pointing to an Internet gateway (IGW) equivalent, such as Azure Virtual Network NAT or a user-defined route (UDR) directing traffic to the internet. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a route has a destination CIDR block of 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0, or if the destination CIDR block does not align with the rule parameters, ensuring that traffic is not unintentionally exposed to the internet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.1: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics dedicated SQL pool has Private Link enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Private Link is not enabled or if the configuration field is set to false.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 1.4.1: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Machine Learning workspace notebook instance is deployed within a Virtual Network (VNet) or within a list of approved subnets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a notebook instance is not deployed within a VNet or if its subnet ID is not included in the parameter list.
Requirements.Name: Azure Machine Learning

Attributes.Section: 1.4.1: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if DNS resolution from peered virtual networks (VNets) to private IP is enabled in Azure Virtual Network Peering. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if DNS resolution from the peered VNet to private IP is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.1: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if both VPN tunnels provided by Azure Site-to-Site VPN are in Connected status. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if one or both tunnels are in Disconnected status.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.1: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure API Management API stage is using an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) web access control list (Web ACL). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure WAF Web ACL is not used or if the applied WAF Web ACL does not match the expected configuration in the rule parameter.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) APIs are configured with the specified endpoint type as defined in the rule parameter. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API does not match the expected endpoint configuration type.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure API Management (APIM) API stage is configured with an SSL certificate. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API stage does not have an associated SSL certificate for secure communication.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) APIs are associated with Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) policies. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an APIM API is not associated with a WAF policy to protect against web threats and vulnerabilities.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Front Door profiles are associated with an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Front Door profile is not linked to a WAF policy, which helps protect against web threats and vulnerabilities.
Requirements.Name: Azure Front Door

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the certificate associated with an Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) endpoint is the default SSL certificate. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure CDN endpoint is using the default SSL certificate instead of a custom-managed certificate.
Requirements.Name: Azure Content Delivery Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure DevOps repository URL contains embedded credentials. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the repository URL includes any username or password in the connection string and COMPLIANT if it does not.
Requirements.Name: Azure DevOps

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) instances are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the public access setting is enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database Migration Service

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cosmos DB manual backups are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any manual backup snapshots are publicly available.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure VPN Client Authorization Rules allow connection access for all clients. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if AccessAll is present and set to true in the Azure Virtual WAN User VPN configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure VPN

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the compliance status of Azure Automation State Configuration (DSC) is COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT after applying the configuration on the virtual machine. The rule is COMPLIANT if the compliance status field is set to COMPLIANT in Azure Policy guest configuration or Azure Automation State Configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Automation State Configuration

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual WAN Hubs have Auto-Accept Shared Connections enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Virtual Hubs setting for automatically accepting shared connections is set to Enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual WAN

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) API server endpoint is not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API server endpoint is exposed to the public internet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Kubernetes Service

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search service is deployed within an Azure Virtual Network (VNet). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the service endpoint is publicly accessible instead of being restricted to a private VNet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cognitive Search

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Application Gateway and Azure Load Balancer listeners are configured to use SSL/TLS certificates from Azure Key Vault. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if at least one load balancer has at least one listener that is not configured with a certificate from Azure Key Vault or is using a certificate from an untrusted source.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Application Gateway uses SSL certificates provided by Azure Key Vault. To use this rule, an SSL or HTTPS listener must be configured with Azure Application Gateway. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Application Gateway is using a self-signed or untrusted SSL certificate instead of a certificate from Azure Key Vault. This rule does not apply to Azure Load Balancer.
Requirements.Name: Azure Aplication Gateway

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure HDInsight cluster has public network access disabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if public network access is enabled or if the NSG (Network Security Group) rules allow inbound traffic on ports other than the required management port (e.g., SSH on Port 22).
Requirements.Name: Azure HDInsight

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) restrict inbound SSH (Port 22) access from the public internet. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there is an NSG rule allowing unrestricted inbound SSH connections (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0).
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Network (VNet) gateways are attached only to authorized virtual networks. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure VPN Gateway or Azure Virtual Network Gateway is attached to an unauthorized VNet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure Function App policy attached to the function resource prohibits public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure Function App policy allows public access. Additionally, it ensures that Azure Private Endpoints or Access Restrictions are properly configured to limit exposure.
Requirements.Name: Azure Functions

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Function App is configured to use a Virtual Network (VNet) Integration. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Function App is not connected to a VNet, which may expose it to public access instead of securing it within a private network.
Requirements.Name: Azure Functions

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) allow unrestricted inbound traffic on default ports for SSH (22) or RDP (3389). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an NSG inbound rule allows traffic from any source (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0) on ports 22 (SSH) or 3389 (RDP), which could expose resources to unauthorized access.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy is configured with a user-defined stateless default action for fragmented packets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the stateless default action for fragmented packets does not match the user-defined default action, which could lead to inconsistent or insecure traffic handling.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy is associated with stateful or stateless rule collections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no stateful or stateless rule collections are associated with the Azure Firewall Policy, ensuring that traffic filtering rules are properly enforced.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy Rule Collection Group contains rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules in a Rule Collection Group, ensuring that traffic filtering is properly enforced.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are public routes in the Azure Route Table pointing to an Internet gateway (IGW) equivalent, such as Azure Virtual Network NAT or a user-defined route (UDR) directing traffic to the internet. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a route has a destination CIDR block of 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0, or if the destination CIDR block does not align with the rule parameters, ensuring that traffic is not unintentionally exposed to the internet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search instances are deployed within an Azure Virtual Network (VNet). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cognitive Search service endpoint is publicly accessible instead of being restricted to a private network using Private Endpoints or Service Endpoints.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cognitive Search

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are any Azure Database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server firewall rules that are not the default firewall rule. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are any custom firewall rules that allow unrestricted access instead of using the default security configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server instances are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publicNetworkAccess field is set to Enabled in the instance configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) dedicated SQL pools are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publicNetworkAccess field is set to Enabled in the workspace or dedicated SQL pool configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics dedicated SQL pool has Private Link enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Private Link is not enabled or if the configuration field is set to false.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage access points have public access blocked. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if public access settings are not disabled for Azure Storage accounts.
Requirements.Name: Azure Blob Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access block settings are configured at the Azure Storage account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the specified settings do not match the corresponding configuration fields in the Azure Storage account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access block settings are configured at the Azure Storage account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the configuration settings do not match one or more specified parameters (or default values).
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage containers are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a storage container is not listed in the excludedPublicContainers parameter and its access level is set to public.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Blob Storage containers do not allow public read access. The rule checks the Public Access Level settings, the container access policies, and the container-level role assignments.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Blob Storage containers do not allow public write access. The rule checks the Public Access Level settings, the container access policies, and the container-level role assignments.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Machine Learning workspace notebook instance is deployed within a Virtual Network (VNet) or within a list of approved subnets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a notebook instance is not deployed within a VNet or if its subnet ID is not included in the parameter list.
Requirements.Name: Azure Machine Learning

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if direct internet access is disabled for an Azure Machine Learning workspace notebook instance. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Machine Learning notebook instance is internet-enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Machine Learning

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Private Endpoint for the service provided in the rule parameter is created for each Azure Virtual Network (VNet). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure VNet does not have a Private Endpoint created for the service.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are unused Network Security Groups (NSGs). The rule is COMPLIANT if each NSG is associated with a subnet or network interface. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an NSG is not associated with any subnet or network interface.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if DNS resolution from peered virtual networks (VNets) to private IP is enabled in Azure Virtual Network Peering. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if DNS resolution from the peered VNet to private IP is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) allowing unrestricted inbound traffic (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0) only permit TCP or UDP connections on authorized ports. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if NSG rules allow inbound traffic on ports not specified in the rule parameters.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if both VPN tunnels provided by Azure Site-to-Site VPN are in Connected status. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if one or both tunnels are in Disconnected status.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) policy contains any rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules defined within the WAF policy rule set.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) global rule contains any conditions. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no conditions are defined within the WAF global rule set.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) Global Web ACL contains any WAF rules or rule groups. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Web ACL does not include any WAF rule or rule group.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) Regional rule group contains any rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules present within a WAF Regional rule group.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) regional rule contains any conditions. This rule is COMPLIANT if the regional rule contains at least one condition and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) regional Web ACL contains any WAF rules or rule groups. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no WAF rules or rule groups present within the Web ACL.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.2: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy is configured with a user-defined stateless default action for fragmented packets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the stateless default action for fragmented packets does not match the user-defined default action, which could lead to inconsistent or insecure traffic handling.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.3: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall policy is configured with a user-defined default stateless action for full packets. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the default stateless action for full packets does not match the user-defined default stateless action.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.3: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy is associated with stateful or stateless rule collections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no stateful or stateless rule collections are associated with the Azure Firewall Policy, ensuring that traffic filtering rules are properly enforced.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.3: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure API Management API stage is using an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) web access control list (Web ACL). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure WAF Web ACL is not used or if the applied WAF Web ACL does not match the expected configuration in the rule parameter.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.4.4: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) APIs are configured with the specified endpoint type as defined in the rule parameter. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API does not match the expected endpoint configuration type.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.4.4: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cache for Redis instances are configured with a custom virtual network (VNet) integration. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cache for Redis instance is using the default network configuration instead of a custom VNet and subnet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cache for Redis

Attributes.Section: 1.4.4: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: For this rule, the rule identifier (INSTANCES_IN_VNET) and rule name (azure-vm-in-vnet) are different.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.4: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Name: Azure Machine Learning

Attributes.Section: 1.4.4: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if DNS resolution from peered virtual networks (VNets) to private IP is enabled in Azure Virtual Network Peering. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if DNS resolution from the peered VNet to private IP is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.4: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if both VPN tunnels provided by Azure Site-to-Site VPN are in Connected status. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if one or both tunnels are in Disconnected status.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.4.4: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets (VMSS) and Azure Virtual Machines (VMs) network configurations are set to assign public IP addresses to their network interfaces. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the default configuration of a VM or VMSS has at least one network interface with public IP assignment enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Machine

Attributes.Section: 1.4.5: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Container Instances (ACI) or Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) pod definitions are configured to share a hosts process namespace with their containers. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the process namespace sharing setting is enabled, allowing containers to access and modify host-level processes.
Requirements.Name: Azure Kubernetes Service

Attributes.Section: 1.4.5: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) APIs are configured with the specified endpoint type as defined in the rule parameter. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the API does not match the expected endpoint configuration type.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Name: Azure Kubernetes Service

Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Application Gateway uses SSL certificates provided by Azure Key Vault. To use this rule, an SSL or HTTPS listener must be configured with Azure Application Gateway. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Application Gateway is using a self-signed or untrusted SSL certificate instead of a certificate from Azure Key Vault. This rule does not apply to Azure Load Balancer.
Requirements.Name: Azure Aplication Gateway

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure HDInsight cluster has public network access disabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if public network access is enabled or if the NSG (Network Security Group) rules allow inbound traffic on ports other than the required management port (e.g., SSH on Port 22).
Requirements.Name: Azure HDInsight

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) restrict inbound SSH (Port 22) access from the public internet. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there is an NSG rule allowing unrestricted inbound SSH connections (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0).
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Network (VNet) gateways are attached only to authorized virtual networks. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure VPN Gateway or Azure Virtual Network Gateway is attached to an unauthorized VNet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure Function App policy attached to the function resource prohibits public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure Function App policy allows public access. Additionally, it ensures that Azure Private Endpoints or Access Restrictions are properly configured to limit exposure.
Requirements.Name: Azure Functions

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Function App is configured to use a Virtual Network (VNet) Integration. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Function App is not connected to a VNet, which may expose it to public access instead of securing it within a private network.
Requirements.Name: Azure Functions

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) allow unrestricted inbound traffic on default ports for SSH (22) or RDP (3389). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an NSG inbound rule allows traffic from any source (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0) on ports 22 (SSH) or 3389 (RDP), which could expose resources to unauthorized access.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy is configured with a user-defined stateless default action for fragmented packets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the stateless default action for fragmented packets does not match the user-defined default action, which could lead to inconsistent or insecure traffic handling.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy is associated with stateful or stateless rule collections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no stateful or stateless rule collections are associated with the Azure Firewall Policy, ensuring that traffic filtering rules are properly enforced.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Firewall Policy Rule Collection Group contains rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules in a Rule Collection Group, ensuring that traffic filtering is properly enforced.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are public routes in the Azure Route Table pointing to an Internet gateway (IGW) equivalent, such as Azure Virtual Network NAT or a user-defined route (UDR) directing traffic to the internet. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a route has a destination CIDR block of 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0, or if the destination CIDR block does not align with the rule parameters, ensuring that traffic is not unintentionally exposed to the internet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search instances are deployed within an Azure Virtual Network (VNet). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cognitive Search service endpoint is publicly accessible instead of being restricted to a private network using Private Endpoints or Service Endpoints.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cognitive Search

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are any Azure Database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server firewall rules that are not the default firewall rule. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are any custom firewall rules that allow unrestricted access instead of using the default security configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server instances are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publicNetworkAccess field is set to Enabled in the instance configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) dedicated SQL pools are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publicNetworkAccess field is set to Enabled in the workspace or dedicated SQL pool configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage access points have public access blocked. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if public access settings are not disabled for Azure Storage accounts.
