Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access block settings are configured at the Azure Storage account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the specified settings do not match the corresponding configuration fields in the Azure Storage account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access block settings are configured at the Azure Storage account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the configuration settings do not match one or more specified parameters (or default values).
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage containers are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a storage container is not listed in the excludedPublicContainers parameter and its access level is set to public.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Blob Storage containers do not allow public read access. The rule checks the Public Access Level settings, the container access policies, and the container-level role assignments.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Blob Storage containers do not allow public write access. The rule checks the Public Access Level settings, the container access policies, and the container-level role assignments.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Machine Learning workspace notebook instance is deployed within a Virtual Network (VNet) or within a list of approved subnets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a notebook instance is not deployed within a VNet or if its subnet ID is not included in the parameter list.
Requirements.Name: Azure Machine Learning

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if direct internet access is disabled for an Azure Machine Learning workspace notebook instance. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Machine Learning notebook instance is internet-enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Machine Learning

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a Private Endpoint for the service provided in the rule parameter is created for each Azure Virtual Network (VNet). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure VNet does not have a Private Endpoint created for the service.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if there are unused Network Security Groups (NSGs). The rule is COMPLIANT if each NSG is associated with a subnet or network interface. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an NSG is not associated with any subnet or network interface.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs) allowing unrestricted inbound traffic (0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0) only permit TCP or UDP connections on authorized ports. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if NSG rules allow inbound traffic on ports not specified in the rule parameters.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) policy contains any rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules defined within the WAF policy rule set.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) global rule contains any conditions. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no conditions are defined within the WAF global rule set.

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) Global Web ACL contains any WAF rules or rule groups. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Web ACL does not include any WAF rule or rule group.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) Regional rule group contains any rules. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no rules present within a WAF Regional rule group.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether an Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) regional rule contains any conditions. This rule is COMPLIANT if the regional rule contains at least one condition and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Attributes.Section: 1.5.1: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) services have access logging enabled for API stages. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if log settings are not configured in the API Management diagnostics settings.

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.1: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.1: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Monitor Alerts have an action group configured for the Activated, Resolved, or No Data state. Optionally checks if any actions match a specified Azure Resource Manager (ARM) ID. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no action group is specified for the alert or optional parameter.

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.1: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a resource type has an Azure Monitor metric alert configured for the specified metric. For resource type, you can specify Azure Managed Disks, Virtual Machines, Azure SQL Databases, or Storage Accounts. The rule is COMPLIANT if the specified metric has an associated resource ID and an active Azure Monitor alert.

Requirements.Description: For this rule, the rule identifier (AZURE_ACTIVITY_LOG_ENABLED) and rule name (azure-activity-log-enabled) are different.

Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure DevOps Pipeline project environment has at least one log option enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the status of all present log configurations is set to DISABLED.
Requirements.Name: Azure DevOps

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled with a valid severity level for Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) replication task events of a target database. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled or replication task logging of a target database has a severity level that is not valid.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB instance cluster has Azure Monitor Diagnostic Settings enabled for audit logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB instance cluster does not have Diagnostic Settings configured to export audit logs.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure VPN Gateway has diagnostic logging enabled for client connections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if diagnostic settings are not configured to capture connection logs.
Requirements.Name: Azure VPN Gateway

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Container Instances have log analytics integration enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an active Azure Container Instance does not have log analytics workspace configured or if logging is not enabled in at least one container definition.
Requirements.Name: Azure Container Instances

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) cluster is configured with logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging for AKS clusters is not enabled for all log types.
Requirements.Name: Azure Kubernetes Service

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure App Service Environments are configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled or if logs are not being sent to Azure Monitor Logs.
Requirements.Name: Azure App

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Load Balancer and Azure Application Gateway have logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if diagnostic logs are not enabled or if logs are not being sent to Azure Monitor Logs or Azure Storage Account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Load Balancer

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Service Bus namespaces have Azure Monitor diagnostic logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Service Bus namespace does not have audit logging enabled and configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs or Azure Storage Account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Service Bus

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Service Bus namespace has Azure Monitor diagnostic logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Service Bus namespace does not have audit logging enabled and configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs or Azure Storage Account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Service Bus

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: For this rule, the rule identifier (MULTI_REGION_AZURE_ACTIVITY_LOG_ENABLED) and rule name (multi-region-azure-activity-log-enabled) are different.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Cosmos DB cluster has Azure Monitor Log export enabled for audit logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cosmos DB cluster does not have Azure Monitor Log export enabled for audit logs.
Requirements.Name: Azrure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Firewall has logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a logging type is not configured. You can specify which logging type you want the rule to check.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database for MySQL Flexible Server is configured to publish audit logs to Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if MySQL Flexible Server does not have audit log publishing configured.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure SQL Database has respective logs enabled in Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any required log types are not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure SQL Database

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) is logging audits to a specific Azure Storage Account. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if audit logging is not enabled for a Synapse Analytics instance or if the specified storage account does not match the configured audit logging destination.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) has the specified security settings. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Synapse Analytics instance is not encrypted, is encrypted with a different key, or does not have audit logging enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if DNS query logging is enabled for your Azure DNS public zones. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if DNS query logging is not enabled for your Azure DNS public zones.
Requirements.Name: Azure DNS

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled for your Azure Storage accounts. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Logic Apps has logging enabled for the workflow executions. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Logic App does not have logging enabled or the logging configuration does not meet the required minimum level.
Requirements.Name: Azure Logic Apps

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Network (VNet) flow logs are enabled for all VNets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if flow logs are not enabled for at least one Azure VNet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled on Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) regional and global web access control lists (Web ACLs). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is enabled but the logging destination does not match the value of the parameter.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled on Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) global web access control lists (web ACLs). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT for a global web ACL if it does not have logging enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.2: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) services have access logging enabled for API stages. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if log settings are not configured in the API Management diagnostics settings.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.3: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if all methods in Azure API Management (APIM) services have logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled, or if the logging level is not set to Error or Information in the diagnostic settings.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.3: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) services have Azure Monitor Application Insights (AI) tracing enabled. The rule is COMPLIANT if Application Insights integration is enabled for API requests, and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.3: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure API Management (APIM) service has diagnostic logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled, or if the log level is neither Error nor Verbose (All logs).
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.3: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Load Balancers (ALB/CLB) are configured with a user-defined desynchronization mitigation mode. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Load Balancer desync mitigation mode does not match the user-defined desync mitigation mode.
Requirements.Name: Azure Load Balances

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.3: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Front Door or Azure CDN profiles are configured to deliver access logs to an Azure Storage Account or Log Analytics Workspace. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Front Door or Azure CDN profile does not have logging configured.
Requirements.Name: Azure Front Door

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.3: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if at least one Azure Monitor Diagnostic Setting is logging Azure Blob Storage data events for all Storage Accounts. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no Diagnostic Settings configured or if no settings record Blob Storage data events.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.3: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.7: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) is logging audits to a specific Azure Storage Account. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if audit logging is not enabled for a Synapse Analytics instance or if the specified storage account does not match the configured audit logging destination.

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.7: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if DNS query logging is enabled for your Azure DNS public zones. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if DNS query logging is not enabled for your Azure DNS public zones.

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.7: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled for your Azure Storage accounts. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled.

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1.7: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Logic Apps has logging enabled for the workflow executions. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Logic App does not have logging enabled or the logging configuration does not meet the required minimum level.

Attributes.Section: 10.2.1: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

Requirements.Description: For this rule, the rule identifier (AZURE_ACTIVITY_LOG_ENABLED) and rule name (azure-activity-log-enabled) are different.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure DevOps Pipeline project environment has at least one log option enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the status of all present log configurations is set to DISABLED.
Requirements.Name: Azure DevOps

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled with a valid severity level for Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) replication task events of a target database. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled or replication task logging of a target database has a severity level that is not valid.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB instance cluster has Azure Monitor Diagnostic Settings enabled for audit logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB instance cluster does not have Diagnostic Settings configured to export audit logs.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure VPN Gateway has diagnostic logging enabled for client connections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if diagnostic settings are not configured to capture connection logs.
Requirements.Name: Azure VPN Gateway

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Container Instances have log analytics integration enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an active Azure Container Instance does not have log analytics workspace configured or if logging is not enabled in at least one container definition.
Requirements.Name: Azure Container Instances

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) cluster is configured with logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging for AKS clusters is not enabled for all log types.
Requirements.Name: Azure Kubernetes Service

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure App Service Environments are configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled or if logs are not being sent to Azure Monitor Logs.
Requirements.Name: Azure App

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Load Balancer and Azure Application Gateway have logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if diagnostic logs are not enabled or if logs are not being sent to Azure Monitor Logs or Azure Storage Account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Load Balancer

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Service Bus namespaces have Azure Monitor diagnostic logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Service Bus namespace does not have audit logging enabled and configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs or Azure Storage Account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Service Bus

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Service Bus namespace has Azure Monitor diagnostic logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Service Bus namespace does not have audit logging enabled and configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs or Azure Storage Account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Service Bus

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: For this rule, the rule identifier (MULTI_REGION_AZURE_ACTIVITY_LOG_ENABLED) and rule name (multi-region-azure-activity-log-enabled) are different.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Cosmos DB cluster has Azure Monitor Log export enabled for audit logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cosmos DB cluster does not have Azure Monitor Log export enabled for audit logs.
Requirements.Name: Azrure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Firewall has logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a logging type is not configured. You can specify which logging type you want the rule to check.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database for MySQL Flexible Server is configured to publish audit logs to Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if MySQL Flexible Server does not have audit log publishing configured.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure SQL Database has respective logs enabled in Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any required log types are not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure SQL Database

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) is logging audits to a specific Azure Storage Account. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if audit logging is not enabled for a Synapse Analytics instance or if the specified storage account does not match the configured audit logging destination.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) has the specified security settings. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Synapse Analytics instance is not encrypted, is encrypted with a different key, or does not have audit logging enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if DNS query logging is enabled for your Azure DNS public zones. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if DNS query logging is not enabled for your Azure DNS public zones.
Requirements.Name: Azure DNS

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled for your Azure Storage accounts. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Logic Apps has logging enabled for the workflow executions. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Logic App does not have logging enabled or the logging configuration does not meet the required minimum level.
Requirements.Name: Azure Logic Apps

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Network (VNet) flow logs are enabled for all VNets. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if flow logs are not enabled for at least one Azure VNet.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Network

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled on Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) regional and global web access control lists (Web ACLs). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is enabled but the logging destination does not match the value of the parameter.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled on Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) global web access control lists (web ACLs). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT for a global web ACL if it does not have logging enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 10.3.1: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Backup Recovery Services vault has an attached resource-based policy that prevents the deletion of recovery points. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Recovery Services vault does not have resource-based policies or has policies without a suitable Deny statement (statement with backup:DeleteRecoveryPoint, backup:UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle, and backup:PutBackupVaultAccessPolicy permissions).
Requirements.Name: Azure Backup

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks that there is at least one Azure Monitor diagnostic setting defined with security best practices.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Monitor log analytics workspaces are encrypted with a specified Azure Key Vault encryption key. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Log Analytics workspace is not encrypted with a Key Vault key or is encrypted with a key not supplied in the rule parameter.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Activity Logs are configured to use Azure Key Vault for server-side encryption (SSE). The rule is COMPLIANT if the key vault key ID is defined for encryption.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Monitor logs have file integrity monitoring enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if log file validation is not enabled for the logs in Azure Monitor.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) instances are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the public access setting is enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database Migration Service

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cosmos DB manual backups are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any manual backup snapshots are publicly available.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Managed Disks snapshots are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if one or more snapshots with a similar public access setting are configured, making them accessible to all users.
Requirements.Name: Azure Managed Disks

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) containers only have read-only access to their root filesystems. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the readOnlyRootFilesystem parameter in the container definition of AKS deployment is set to false.
Requirements.Name: Azure Kubernetes Service

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Files access points are configured to enforce a root directory. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the value of Path is set to / (default root directory of the file share).
Requirements.Name: Azure Files

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Files access points are configured to enforce a user identity. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if PosixUser is not defined or if parameters are provided and there is no match in the corresponding parameter.
Requirements.Name: Azure Files

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure HDInsight cluster has public network access disabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if public network access is enabled or if the NSG (Network Security Group) rules allow inbound traffic on ports other than the required management port (e.g., SSH on Port 22).
Requirements.Name: Azure HDInsight

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure Function App policy attached to the function resource prohibits public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure Function App policy allows public access. Additionally, it ensures that Azure Private Endpoints or Access Restrictions are properly configured to limit exposure.
Requirements.Name: Azure Functions

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Cosmos DB manual database snapshot is public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any existing or new Azure Cosmos DB snapshot is publicly accessible.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database for MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server instances are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publicNetworkAccess field is set to Enabled in the instance configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure SQL Database backups are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any existing or new Azure SQL Database backups are publicly accessible.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) dedicated SQL pools are not publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the publicNetworkAccess field is set to Enabled in the workspace or dedicated SQL pool configuration.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage access points have public access blocked. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if public access settings are not disabled for Azure Storage accounts.
Requirements.Name: Azure Blob Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access block settings are configured at the Azure Storage account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the specified settings do not match the corresponding configuration fields in the Azure Storage account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the required public access block settings are configured at the Azure Storage account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the configuration settings do not match one or more specified parameters (or default values).
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage containers are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a storage container is not listed in the excludedPublicContainers parameter and its access level is set to public.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage has soft delete enabled for blobs in the container. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if soft delete for blobs is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Blob Storage containers do not allow public read access. The rule checks the Public Access Level settings, the container access policies, and the container-level role assignments.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if your Azure Blob Storage containers do not allow public write access. The rule checks the Public Access Level settings, the container access policies, and the container-level role assignments.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if direct internet access is disabled for an Azure Machine Learning workspace notebook instance. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Machine Learning notebook instance is internet-enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Machine Learning

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Automation runbooks owned by the account are public. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Azure Automation runbooks with the owner set to Self are public.
Requirements.Name: Azure Automations

Attributes.Section: 10.3.2: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure SQL Database clusters are protected by an automatic backup policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure SQL Database cluster is not protected by an automatic backup policy.
Requirements.Name: Azure Database

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Backup policy has a backup rule that satisfies the required frequency and retention period. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if recovery points are not created at least as often as the specified frequency or expire before the specified period.
Requirements.Name: Azure Backup

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Backup recovery point expires no earlier than after the specified period. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the recovery point has a retention point that is less than the required retention period.
Requirements.Name: Azure Backup

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks that there is at least one Azure Monitor diagnostic setting defined with security best practices.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Monitor log analytics workspaces are encrypted with a specified Azure Key Vault encryption key. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Log Analytics workspace is not encrypted with a Key Vault key or is encrypted with a key not supplied in the rule parameter.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Activity Logs are configured to use Azure Key Vault for server-side encryption (SSE). The rule is COMPLIANT if the key vault key ID is defined for encryption.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Monitor logs have file integrity monitoring enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if log file validation is not enabled for the logs in Azure Monitor.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure SQL Database instances have backups enabled. Optionally, the rule checks the backup retention period and the backup window.
Requirements.Name: Azure SQL Database

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether Azure Cosmos DB tables are present in Azure Backup Plans. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Azure Cosmos DB tables are not included in any Azure Backup Plan.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if point-in-time restore (PITR) is enabled for Azure Cosmos DB tables. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if PITR is not enabled for Azure Cosmos DB tables.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cosmos DB tables are protected by a backup plan. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Cosmos DB Table is not covered by a backup plan.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Managed Disks are included in an Azure Backup policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Azure Managed Disks are not covered by a backup policy in Azure Backup.
Requirements.Name: Azure Managed Disks

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Managed Disks are protected by a backup policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure Managed Disk is not covered by a backup policy in Azure Backup.
Requirements.Name: Azure Managed Disks

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Machines are protected by a backup policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure Virtual Machine is not covered by a backup policy in Azure Backup.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Machines

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Files file shares are included in an Azure Backup policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Azure Files shares are not covered by an Azure Backup policy.
Requirements.Name: Azure Files

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Files file shares are protected by an Azure Backup policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure Files share is not covered by a backup policy.
Requirements.Name: Azure Files

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cache for Redis has automatic backup enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the backup retention period for the Redis cache is less than the required retention period.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cache

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Files or Azure NetApp Files are protected by a backup plan. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure File Share or NetApp File System is not covered by a backup plan.
Requirements.Name: Azure Files

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Files or Azure NetApp Files are protected by a backup plan. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure File Share or NetApp File System is not covered by a backup plan.
Requirements.Name: Azure Files

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure SQL databases are included in an Azure Backup policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Azure SQL databases are not part of any Azure Backup plan.
Requirements.Name: Azure SQL Database

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure SQL Managed Instances are protected by an Azure Backup policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure SQL Managed Instance is not included in an Azure Backup plan.
Requirements.Name: Azure SQL Database

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics dedicated SQL pools have automated snapshots enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the retention period for automated snapshots is greater than the maximum allowed retention period, less than the minimum retention period, or set to 0.
Requirements.Name: Azure Synapse Analytics

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage containers are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a storage container is not listed in the excludedPublicContainers parameter and its access level is set to public.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage containers are protected by a backup policy. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure Blob Storage container is not covered by a backup policy.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.3: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) with Azure Blob Storage origin has managed identity authentication configured. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Azure CDN endpoint is backed by Azure Blob Storage and does not have managed identity authentication configured, or if the origin is not a Blob Storage container.
Requirements.Name: Azure Content Delivery Network

Attributes.Section: 10.3.4: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) profile with an Azure Blob Storage origin has managed identity authentication enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT for Azure CDN profiles with Blob Storage origins that do not have managed identity authentication enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Content Delivery Network

Attributes.Section: 10.3.4: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks that there is at least one Azure Monitor diagnostic setting defined with security best practices.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.4: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Monitor log analytics workspaces are encrypted with a specified Azure Key Vault encryption key. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Log Analytics workspace is not encrypted with a Key Vault key or is encrypted with a key not supplied in the rule parameter.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.4: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Activity Logs are configured to use Azure Key Vault for server-side encryption (SSE). The rule is COMPLIANT if the key vault key ID is defined for encryption.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.4: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Monitor logs have file integrity monitoring enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if log file validation is not enabled for the logs in Azure Monitor.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.3.4: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if the Azure Blob Storage container has immutable blob storage enabled by default. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if immutable blob storage is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.4: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage containers are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a storage container is not listed in the excludedPublicContainers parameter and its access level is set to public.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.4: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if versioning is enabled for your Azure Blob Storage containers. Optionally, the rule checks if immutable storage with versioning is enabled for your containers. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if versioning is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.3.4: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) services have Azure Monitor Application Insights (AI) tracing enabled. The rule is COMPLIANT if Application Insights integration is enabled for API requests, and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a resource type has an Azure Monitor metric alert configured for the specified metric. For resource type, you can specify Azure Managed Disks, Virtual Machines, Azure SQL Databases, or Storage Accounts. The rule is COMPLIANT if the specified metric has an associated resource ID and an active Azure Monitor alert.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Monitor Diagnostic settings are configured to send logs to Log Analytics workspace. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no diagnostic settings are configured to send logs to Log Analytics.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Machines have diagnostic settings configured to enable detailed monitoring. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if diagnostic settings are not enabled to capture detailed performance metrics.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Machines

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Security Center is enabled for an Azure subscription. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Azure Security Center is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Security Center

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Service Bus logging is enabled for the delivery status of messages sent to a queue or topic for the endpoints. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the delivery status notification for messages is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Service Bus

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) security metrics collection on rule groups is enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the VisibilityConfig.CloudWatchMetricsEnabled equivalent field is set to false.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) services have Azure Monitor Application Insights (AI) tracing enabled. The rule is COMPLIANT if Application Insights integration is enabled for API requests, and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a resource type has an Azure Monitor metric alert configured for the specified metric. For resource type, you can specify Azure Managed Disks, Virtual Machines, Azure SQL Databases, or Storage Accounts. The rule is COMPLIANT if the specified metric has an associated resource ID and an active Azure Monitor alert.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Machines have diagnostic settings configured to enable detailed monitoring. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if diagnostic settings are not enabled to capture detailed performance metrics.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Machines

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Security Center is enabled for an Azure subscription. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Azure Security Center is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Security Center

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Service Bus logging is enabled for the delivery status of messages sent to a queue or topic for the endpoints. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the delivery status notification for messages is not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Service Bus

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) security metrics collection on rule groups is enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the VisibilityConfig.CloudWatchMetricsEnabled equivalent field is set to false.
Requirements.Name: Azure Network

Attributes.Section: 10.4.1: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) services have Azure Monitor Application Insights (AI) tracing enabled. The rule is COMPLIANT if Application Insights integration is enabled for API requests, and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Monitor Alerts have an action group configured for the Activated, Resolved, or No Data state. Attributes.Section: 10.4.2: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a resource type has an Azure Monitor metric alert configured for the specified metric. The rule is COMPLIANT if the specified metric has an associated resource ID and an active Azure Monitor alert.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.4.2: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Attributes.Section: 10.4.2: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Security Center is enabled for an Azure subscription. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Azure Security Center is not enabled.

Attributes.Section: 10.4.2: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Service Bus logging is enabled for the delivery status of messages sent to a queue or topic for the endpoints. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the delivery status notification for messages is not enabled.

Attributes.Section: 10.4.2: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Web Application Firewall (WAF) security metrics collection on rule groups is enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the VisibilityConfig.CloudWatchMetricsEnabled equivalent field is set to false.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Monitor Alerts have an action group configured for the Activated, Resolved, or No Data state. Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.4.3: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Backup policy has a backup rule that satisfies the required frequency and retention period. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if recovery points are not created at least as often as the specified frequency or expire before the specified period.
Requirements.Name: Azure Backup

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Backup recovery point expires no earlier than after the specified period. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the recovery point has a retention point that is less than the required retention period.
Requirements.Name: Azure Backup

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks that there is at least one Azure Monitor diagnostic setting defined with security best practices.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Monitor Log Analytics Workspace retention period is set to greater than 365 days or a specified retention period. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the retention period is less than MinRetentionTime, if specified, or else 365 days.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Cosmos DB cluster retention period is set to a specific number of days. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the retention period is less than the value specified by the parameter.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if point-in-time restore (PITR) is enabled for Azure Cosmos DB tables. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if PITR is not enabled for Azure Cosmos DB tables.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Managed Disks are attached to Virtual Machines. Optionally, checks if Managed Disks are configured to be deleted when the Virtual Machine is terminated.
Requirements.Name: Azure Managed Disks

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a private Azure Container Registry (ACR) repository has at least one lifecycle policy configured. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no lifecycle policy is configured for the ACR private repository.
Requirements.Name: Azure Container Registry

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search services are configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is COMPLIANT if logging is enabled for an Azure Cognitive Search instance. This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not configured.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cognitive Search

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search services have audit logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cognitive Search service does not have audit logging enabled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search services are configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not configured.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cognitive Search

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if a lifecycle management policy is configured for an Azure Blob Storage container. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no active lifecycle management policies or if the configuration does not match the parameter values.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Blob Storage containers with versioning enabled have a lifecycle management policy configured. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if lifecycle management policies are not enabled.
Requirements.Name: Azure Storage

Attributes.Section: 10.5.1: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) services have access logging enabled for API stages. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if log settings are not configured in the API Management diagnostics settings.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if all methods in Azure API Management (APIM) services have logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled, or if the logging level is not set to Error or Information in the diagnostic settings.
Requirements.Name: Azure API Management

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure API Management (APIM) services have Azure Monitor Application Insights (AI) tracing enabled. The rule is COMPLIANT if Application Insights integration is enabled for API requests, and NON_COMPLIANT otherwise.

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure API Management (APIM) service has diagnostic logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled, or if the log level is neither Error nor Verbose (All logs).

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Load Balancers (ALB/CLB) are configured with a user-defined desynchronization mitigation mode. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Load Balancer desync mitigation mode does not match the user-defined desync mitigation mode.

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Front Door or Azure CDN profiles are configured to deliver access logs to an Azure Storage Account or Log Analytics Workspace. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Front Door or Azure CDN profile does not have logging configured.

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if at least one Azure Monitor Diagnostic Setting is logging Azure Blob Storage data events for all Storage Accounts. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if there are no Diagnostic Settings configured or if no settings record Blob Storage data events.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure DevOps Pipeline project environment has at least one log option enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the status of all present log configurations is set to DISABLED.
Requirements.Name: Azure DevOps

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if logging is enabled with a valid severity level for Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) replication task events of a target database. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled or replication task logging of a target database has a severity level that is not valid.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB instance cluster has Azure Monitor Diagnostic Settings enabled for audit logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB instance cluster does not have Diagnostic Settings configured to export audit logs.
Requirements.Name: Azure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure VPN Gateway has diagnostic logging enabled for client connections. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if diagnostic settings are not configured to capture connection logs.
Requirements.Name: Azure VPN Gateway

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Virtual Machines have diagnostic settings configured to enable detailed monitoring. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if diagnostic settings are not enabled to capture detailed performance metrics.
Requirements.Name: Azure Virtual Machines

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) containers only have read-only access to their root filesystems. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the readOnlyRootFilesystem parameter in the container definition of AKS deployment is set to false.
Requirements.Name: Azure Backup

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Container Instances have log analytics integration enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an active Azure Container Instance does not have log analytics workspace configured or if logging is not enabled in at least one container definition.
Requirements.Name: Azure Container Instances

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) cluster is configured with logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging for AKS clusters is not enabled for all log types.
Requirements.Name: Azure Kubernetes Service

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure App Service Environments are configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if logging is not enabled or if logs are not being sent to Azure Monitor Logs.
Requirements.Name: Azure App

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Load Balancer and Azure Application Gateway have logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if diagnostic logs are not enabled or if logs are not being sent to Azure Monitor Logs or Azure Storage Account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Load Balancer

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks whether Azure Active Directory (AAD) users are members of at least one Azure AD group. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an AAD user is not a member of any AD group.
Requirements.Name: Azure Active Directory

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Service Bus namespaces have Azure Monitor diagnostic logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a Service Bus namespace does not have audit logging enabled and configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs or Azure Storage Account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Service Bus

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Service Bus namespace has Azure Monitor diagnostic logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Service Bus namespace does not have audit logging enabled and configured to send logs to Azure Monitor Logs or Azure Storage Account.
Requirements.Name: Azure Service Bus

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: For this rule, the rule identifier (MULTI_REGION_AZURE_ACTIVITY_LOG_ENABLED) and rule name (multi-region-azure-activity-log-enabled) are different.
Requirements.Name: Azure Monitor

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Cosmos DB cluster has Azure Monitor Log export enabled for audit logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Azure Cosmos DB cluster does not have Azure Monitor Log export enabled for audit logs.
Requirements.Name: Azrure Cosmos DB

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Firewall has logging enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a logging type is not configured. You can specify which logging type you want the rule to check.

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Cognitive Search domains have fine-grained access control enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Azure Cognitive Search advanced security features, such as role-based access control (RBAC), are not enabled for the search service.

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Database for MySQL Flexible Server is configured to publish audit logs to Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if MySQL Flexible Server does not have audit log publishing configured.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure SQL Database has respective logs enabled in Azure Monitor Logs. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any required log types are not enabled.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse) is logging audits to a specific Azure Storage Account. Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.

Requirements.Description: Checks if an Azure Blob Storage container policy does not allow blocklisted container-level and object-level actions on resources in the container for principals from other Azure subscriptions. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any blocklisted actions are allowed by the Azure Blob Storage container policy.

Requirements.Description: Checks if Azure Service Bus logging is enabled for the delivery status of messages sent to a queue or topic for the endpoints. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the delivery status notification for messages is not enabled.

Attributes.Section: 10.6.3: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time settings across all systems.
